In 2008, Microsoft wanted to purchase [[Yahoo]] (first completely, later partially) in order to strengthen its position on the search engine market vis-Ã -vis [[Google]].<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/7451946.stm BBC NEWS | Business | Yahoo-Google agree online ad deal<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/7407585.stm BBC NEWS | Business | Microsoft mulls fresh Yahoo deal<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> The company rejected the offer, saying that it undervalued the company. In response, Microsoft withdrew its offer.{{Citation needed|date=July 2008}}<!-- need citation -->
In 2008, Microsoft wanted to purchase [[Yahoo]] (first completely, later partially) in order to strengthen its position on the search engine market vis-Ã -vis [[Google]].<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/7451946.stm BBC NEWS | Business | Yahoo-Google agree online ad deal<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/7407585.stm BBC NEWS | Business | Microsoft mulls fresh Yahoo deal<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> The company rejected the offer, saying that it undervalued the company. In response, Microsoft withdrew its offer.{{Citation needed|date=July 2008}}<!-- need citation -->
â   â
[[File:Windows 7.png|Windows 7|thumb|[[Windows 7]], released October 22, 2009]]
 
In 2009, the opening show of the [[CES]] was hosted by [[Steve Ballmer]] for the first time. In past years, it has been hosted by [[Bill Gates]]. In the show, Ballmer announced the first public Beta Test of [[Windows 7]] for partners and developers on January 8, but also for general public on January 10.
In 2009, the opening show of the [[CES]] was hosted by [[Steve Ballmer]] for the first time. In past years, it has been hosted by [[Bill Gates]]. In the show, Ballmer announced the first public Beta Test of [[Windows 7]] for partners and developers on January 8, but also for general public on January 10.
